column5: I went to  subway the other day ,didn't see the contest or would of filled it out,, I could use your boat.
Hey Dave, when I win your boat can you help me take all the sponsor decals off it.

I had a Subway sub a couple of days ago at the location across from the Oakville GO station. They had the big Dave Mercer "Win my boat" contest sign right by the cash register and ballots on the counter. I filled out the ballot & dropped it in the slot. Figured "what the heck", I was already in there to get some eats, so I'll give 'er a go.
2 ballots in so far
If someone is gonna win your boat for gods sake don't hit the dock or any rocks with it...........
2nd day to Subway in Kingston and notta.....

naw Daves so short they would be at a respectable height. Now if Roy gets his picture.... then it would be a different story.   Art

I saw Dave to-day, in a Sudbway in Sudbury.

E-Mail Subway    For those that didn't get ballets at stores, I was at Port Elgin Monday Sub break from fishing & they didn't know about it so I e-mailed Subway & got a reply from the Port Elgin store owner saying, he had a few stores & when he receives them he will gladly send me a couple of Ballets CAN"T beat that, Dave GREAT CONTEST & PROMOTION, I'm going to win it I think Richard
Were is my lawyer?!!!! It seems my name is not YOU it is USA so I can't win the boat. I am glad though for all of yall up North that get a chance to win that puppy.   Art
You don't need to worry about becoming   boatless. When I win it I'll give you mine to use.  Thanks for the heads up, I'll have to make Subway a sure stop for lunch.

Check this out guys Subway is giving away my boat! It would be awesome if an OFC'er won.  HOOK, LINE AND SUBWAY®  April 5th, 2010 Port Perry, ON  Starting April 5th, 2010 fishing fans will have a chance to hook the catch of a lifetime at participating Ontario Subway® restaurants with the Hook, Line and SUBWAY® contest. This 13- week contest will award weekly prizes from great companies like Shimano, Berkley, Rapala, Fuji and Bass Pro Shops. But the ultimate prize? Dave Mercer's very own bass boat! A Skeeter FX20 equipped with the brand new 250hp Yamaha VMAX SHO worth over $75,000.00. This is the actual boat that Dave uses every week on his television show, Dave Mercer's Facts of Fishing® THE SHOW.  Lucky fishing fans simply have to visit a participating SUBWAY® restaurant, enjoy a Fresh Value Meal®, complete a ballot and they could find themselves reeling in this dream boat.  "I don't know if this makes SUBWAY® restaurants the best sponsor or worst sponsor I could have," Mercer said jokingly. "Because they are actually giving away my boat. I mean, I've seen contests similar to this in the past where companies gave away a replica prize of some sort. But this is actually MY boat! Winning this boat will truly be a dream come true for one lucky angler and its amazing to have such a great companies supporting our sport.  Hook, Line and SUBWAY® runs April 5th to July 5th, 2010 at all participating Ontario SUBWAY® restaurants. So make sure to get in and Hook, Line and SUBWAY® yourself a new boat!
